channel.title: Care2 Healthy Living
channel.description: more than 15,000 ways to enhance your life

item.title: Easy Gift Ideas to Show Appreciation
item.dc:creator: Care2 Healthy Living Guest Blogger
item.description: It truly is the thought that counts, not just in gift-giving but in every aspect of any relationship. Although it’s easy to stay connected in the virtual world of social media, true connection comes from more than a double-tap on an Instagram photo or an encouraging Facebook comment. While we often have the best of […]

item.title: How to Grow Fruit All Year Round
item.dc:creator: Ashlyn Kittrell
item.description: Have you ever wanted to taste an apple that you grew yourself? Luckily, this isn’t a luxury reserved for orchard owners. This infographic from Happy to Survive gives all the details you need to start your very own fruit bearing plants. Read the infographic to found out just how long you have to wait before […]

item.title: Polydactyl Cats: The Felines With Extra Toes
item.dc:creator: Vetstreet.com
item.description: Regular cats have five toes on their front feet and four on their back, for a total of 18. But polydactyl [pronounced pol-ee-dak-til] cats boast more toes, usually on their front feet. If the word “polydactyl” sounds like Greek to you, that’s because it is — the Greek root poly means “many” and daktylos means […]

item.title: How I Became a Morning Person (And How You Can Too)
item.dc:creator: Diana Vilibert
item.description: There are two kinds of people in this world. Those who spring out of bed at dawn, totally refreshed and looking like they live in a face wash commercial…and the rest of us, who hate those people. Whether you’re a morning bird or a night owl is mostly built into your genes (and there are […]

item.title: 9 Tips on How to Communicate During a Conflict
item.dc:creator: Zoe Blarowski
item.description: Have you ever been so angry at someone you said something you instantly regretted? There are more constructive ways to communicate during a conflict that can effectively turn the situation around. Keep some of these tips in mind next time you’re facing a disagreement. How does conflict start? Everyone has a need to feel understood, […]

item.title: Earth Week Daily Action: Go Paperless
item.dc:creator: Diane MacEachern
item.description: Paper is the bane of the planet’s existence. Mine, too. Paper is pretty cheap in the scheme of things, so most people don’t think twice about how they use it. But every aspect of producing paper takes a significant environmental toll: * Forests may be clear cut for the pulp used to make paper fibers. […]

item.title: 15 Healthy Foods You Should Eat in Moderation
item.dc:creator: Brian Syuki
item.description: Healthy foods should make 80-90 percent of your diet, if not all. But some healthy foods should be eaten in moderation due to their high calorie content. As you may know, eating healthy foods is not enough for weight loss. You have to maintain a calorie deficit. If not eaten in moderation, the foods below […]

item.title: Daily Cute: Puppies in Slow Mo
item.dc:creator: Healthy Living Editors
item.description: What is one way to make puppies even cuter? Record their actions in slow motion! Check back daily for more adorable animal videos.

item.title: 9 Companies Making Luxurious, All-Natural Perfumes
item.dc:creator: TreeHugger
item.description: Finding out what’s in your lipstick, shampoo and lotion is getting easier as more consumers demand to know and understand ingredient lists. But perfume and cologne remain the last bastions of opaqueness – the products of a veiled, vague industry in which manufacturers cite “industry secrets” and “proprietary fragrance” as the reason for not revealing […]

item.title: This Simple Ingredient Helps Chemotherapy-Induced Rash
item.dc:creator: Dr. Michael Greger
item.description: A review in the Journal of Drugs in Dermatology notes oatmeal has been used for centuries as a topical soothing agent on the skin to relieve itch and irritation in dermatology. Of course, that was coming from Johnson & Johnson, which sells a brand of oatmeal lotion. But if it helps with dry skin or […]

item.title: 5 Tactics to Get Your Dog to Pee in the Rain
item.dc:creator: Vetstreet.com
item.description: My Pug, Willy, is a picky pottier under the best circumstances. He sniffs for minutes on end, spins a little, then changes his mind at the last second and goes searching for a better area. Any changes in the weather, such as wind, snow or rain, complicate his already-picky potty habits and make his bathroom […]

item.title: A Toke a Day Keeps the Doctor Away
item.dc:creator: Ann Pietrangelo
item.description: Alone in her Birmingham, England home, a woman stirs a half teaspoon of cannabis into her hot tea. By seeking relief from pain and spasms caused by multiple sclerosis in this way she is, in the eyes of the law, a criminal. She doesn’t take this action lightly and is not out for a recreational […]

item.title: Study Finds Carcinogen in Common Breakfast Foods
item.dc:creator: Michelle Schoffro Cook
item.description: Call me crazy, but the most important meal of the day should not contain poison. But, according to a new study, that’s exactly what many of the breakfast foods we eat actually contain. The study, conducted by the Alliance for Natural Health USA (ANH-USA)—an international organization dedicated to promoting sustainable health—reveals that 10 out of […]

item.title: 10 Thermogenic Foods to Boost Your Metabolism
item.dc:creator: Maggie McCracken
item.description: Metabolism is a tricky thing. Metabolism—your body’s method of deriving energy from the food you consume—occurs at different speeds in different people, has varying levels of efficiency and requires differing amounts of energy. In other words, your individual body, the food you’re metabolizing, along with other variables affect how you process the foods and drinks […]

item.title: How a Daily Journaling Ritual Could Make You Happier
item.dc:creator: Elise Moreau
item.description: Writing in a diary or journal just for yourself is therapeutic both on a mental and physical level. Regardless of an individual’s writing skills, some interesting research suggests that regularly putting pen to paper as an emotional outlet that not only reduces stress, but also boosts the immune system. Journaling can benefit practically anyone (with the exception […]

item.title: Daily Cute: Inky the Fist Bumping Goat
item.dc:creator: Healthy Living Editors
item.description: Usually, when people “fist bump” they use their actual fists. This adorable baby goat has a different idea. Sure enough, each time a fist gets put out, he bumps it with his head. Source: Inky The Fist Bumping Goat by ViralHog on Rumble Check back daily for more adorable animal videos.

item.title: Earth Week Daily Action: Pack a Waste-Free Lunch
item.dc:creator: Diane MacEachern
item.description: If you’re still getting lunch to-go when you’re at work, Earth Week is the perfect time to pick at least one day to start the habit of bringing lunch from home. Why bother? Because bringing your own has so many environmental benefits—and usually tastes better, too. Food packaging is a big source of waste. You […]

item.title: 5 Steps to Pay for Senior Care with Family Funds
item.dc:creator: Caring.com
item.description: For families with aging parents, the prospect of paying for senior care can be daunting. With many unknown variables, it’s impossible to calculate precisely how much money parents will need to live out their golden years in comfort—which makes budgeting for long-term care challenging. Nevertheless, it’s crucial to come up with some type of payment plan […]

item.title: Men’s Health and the Affordable Care Act
item.dc:creator: Bedsider
item.description: We talk a lot about the awesome things that the Affordable Care Act (ACA, a.k.a. ObamaCare) has done for women’s health, including (but definitely not limited to) birth control coverage without out-of-pocket costs. The ACA also covers a lot of preventive services related to sexual health beyond birth control. Preventive care is important for men, too—so what’s covered for them? What’s covered […]

item.title: 6 Things That Define You More Than Your Work
item.dc:creator: Katie Medlock
item.description: “What do you do?” may be the most common follow-up question to “What is your name?” when meeting someone new. Perhaps our responses make for good small talk, but even in more sincere exchanges we talk about our professions as if they are an extension of our innermost identity. For some, this may certainly be […]

item.title: 3 Natural Deodorants That Actually Work
item.dc:creator: Jordyn Cormier
item.description: Ah, the classic conundrum—you want to put only good, natural things in and on your body, but your armpits seem to only agree with deodorants that are definitely not those things. Do any of these natural deodorants actually work? Deodorant is an extremely important product to keep pure. It’s spread over a sensitive area day in […]

item.title: Earth Week Daily Action: Change 5 Light Bulbs to LEDs
item.dc:creator: Diane MacEachern
item.description: One of the simplest steps you can take during Earth Week is to change out some lightbulbs. In fact, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency recommends you switch out bulbs in the 5 lights you use the most. Usually, that means the lights in the kitchen, living room, bedroom, bathroom and on your porch. Until recently, […]

item.title: Are Frozen Fruits and Vegetables Healthier Than Fresh?
item.dc:creator: Zoe Blarowski
item.description: It may seem like a natural assumption that fresh fruits and vegetables are more nutritious. But research shows this can be a false assumption. Frozen fruits and vegetables can be more nutritious than their unprocessed counterparts. Brief Overview of Commercial Freezing Processes Vegetables are typically blanched prior to freezing. This means they are submerged in […]

item.title: Hidden Pedicure Risks and How To Avoid Them
item.dc:creator: Ann Pietrangelo
item.description: Ahh, the season for sandals and bare feet is upon us. The last thing you need is an unsightly and painful toenail infection. Whether you're a nail salon regular or if, like me, you've never had a pedicure, it's not something to take lightly. You're going to want to do your homework before baring your toes in the salon because those hidden pedicure risks can jeopardize your health.

item.title: Daily Cute: Corgi Is Thrilled With Shopping Cart Full of Dirt
item.dc:creator: Healthy Living Editors
item.description: What better toy than an endless amount of dirt? This corgi is thrilled to have a bunch to dig and play in! Source: Corgi hilariously can’t stop digging in the dirt by nitrowolf on Rumble Check back daily for more adorable animal videos.

item.title: The Top US Cities for Urban Farming
item.dc:creator: TreeHugger
item.description: There is so much to love about growing your own food – it’s cheap, its lack of travel requirements and packaging make it sustainable, you know what was used in its creation, and then of course, it’s literally as fresh as it can be. There is simply nothing like plucking a tomato off the stem […]

item.title: Grain-Free Basil and Mint Summer Squash ‘Noodles’
item.dc:creator: Amie Valpone
item.description: This dish is a terrific healthy staple that’s full of flavor and fiber without any grains. Did you happen to notice the simple directions for this recipe? Combine ingredients and serve. Easy as it gets. Enjoy! Grain-Free Basil and Mint Summer Squash ‘Noodles’ SERVES 2 3 large yellow summer squash, cut into thin strands with a vegetable […]

item.title: 15 Foods You Didn’t Know You Could Freeze
item.dc:creator: TreeHugger
item.description: Food waste continues to be a serious problem, with an estimated 30 to 40 percent of food intended for human consumption going to landfill. While some of the spoilage occurs in the field and during processing and transportation to supermarkets, the vast majority happens in refrigerators, where too many items end up languishing till they […]

item.title: Sick of Popcorn? Try These Popping Grains
item.dc:creator: Jordyn Cormier
item.description: I am fanatical about popcorn. What’s not to love? Toss some organic kernels on the stove in a glorious gob of coconut oil and, within seconds, you have a magical, crunchy snack. But, corn isn’t the only grain you can pop. There are other super-healthy grains that can help you satiate your weekly popcorn quota. Oh, you don’t have […]

item.title: 5 Mind Tricks That Will Help You Stick to Any Diet
item.dc:creator: Diane Vukovic
item.description: You want to lose weight or get healthier, so you make a resolution to go on a diet. You start out strong but, usually within a week, you suddenly find yourself back in your old bad dietary habits. Don’t feel too guilty about this. It is really hard to break bad habits with willpower alone. […]

item.title: Can 15 Minutes Of Your Time Save The Life of a Shelter Animal?
item.dc:creator: Lisa Spector
item.description: What do Martha Stewart, Jason Schwartzman and Kesha have in common? They are all celebrities speaking up for animals that don’t have a voice and inspiring people to take action in helping homeless and abused animals. In the video below, along with 50 Cent, Edie Falco, Nathan Lane, Julie Bowen, Krysten Ritter and others, they […]

item.title: Study Shows Sugar-Free Still Rots Teeth
item.dc:creator: Joe Leech
item.description: Added sugar is a health hazard. Not only can sugar be incredibly harmful for those with insulin resistance, but the extra calories of sugar-laden junk foods is one of the primary drivers of weight gain and tooth decay. For this reason sugar-free alternatives, such as artificial sweeteners and diet drinks, are often perceived as “guilt-free.” […]

item.title: Daily Cute: Baby Bat Burritos
item.dc:creator: Healthy Living Editors
item.description: It’s National Bat Appreciation Day! Why not appreciate the cuteness of these little guys who were rescued by the Austrailian Bat Clinic?

item.title: Hand Dye Yarn With Your Slow Cooker
item.dc:creator: Lauren Bowen
item.description: There’s nothing better than coming home after a long day of activity to the comforting smell of dinner already cooking; it’s kind of a dream come true! While slow-cookers are a fantastic way to create a delicious meal with very little preparation or attention (here are a few vegan recipes to get you started), crock pots also have some […]

item.title: Why Does My Cat Knock Everything Off My Desk?
item.dc:creator: Vetstreet.com
item.description: As numerous hilarious Internet videos show, our cats seem to love to knock things off high places. Why do they engage in this funny — but also sometimes annoying or even dangerous — behavior? Anyone who has cats knows they are very adept in using their paws. Watching cats play, you can see them bat […]

item.title: Eating Fast Food Linked to Significantly Higher Phthalate Levels
item.dc:creator: TreeHugger
item.description: If the fat, salt and calories in fast food weren’t enough, how about a mouthful of phthalates? A study from the Milken Institute School of Public Health (Milken Institute SPH) at George Washington University found that people who reported eating more fast food were exposed to higher levels of phthalates. We’ve been talking about phthalates for years […]

item.title: Losing Sleep Makes You 50 Percent More Likely to Get Sick
item.dc:creator: Katie Medlock
item.description: Quality sleep is one of those things we don’t prioritize as much as we should, even though we know it can be very important in our daily lives. Just like eating healthy on a consistent basis and making sure we are not sitting down for more than half our waking hours, in the back of […]

item.title: Celebrating Bats on Bat Appreciation Day
item.dc:creator: Zoe Eisenberg
item.description: Bats do a whole lot more than cruise the skies at night. They play an important role in balancing our ecosystem, eating harmful insects and acting as natural pest control. And although some people think bats are freaky looking, there are hundreds of reasons to love these flying mammals. 5 Fun Bat Facts For Bat […]

item.title: What We Know So Far About Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
item.dc:creator: Diana Herrington
item.description: There are almost 2.5 million Americans with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (CFS), medically known as myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME) that robs people of a full life. Many are bed-ridden and unable to care for themselves, living in a ‘one room world’ because they are unable to get out and are often very sensitive to fragrances and sound. […]

item.title: The Stages of Romantic Relationships
item.dc:creator: Maggie McCracken
item.description: People often refer to the “honeymoon phase” as the pinnacle of happiness in romantic relationships. However, psychologists and relationship experts would probably tell you different. The first few years of coupledom may be lovey-dovey, but a deeper and more intimate bond is formed after a couple has weathered some storms and entered the committed phase […]

item.title: Daily Action to Celebate Earth Week: Restore Nature
item.dc:creator: Diane MacEachern
item.description: The week leading up to Earth Day is a great time to focus attention on the individual steps we can each take to help protect the planet and ourselves. That’s why, throughout Earth Week (April 17 – April 23) we’ll be highlighting a daily action that can make a difference. First up: Restore Nature Nature […]

item.title: Two Ways You And Your Family Can Help Prevent Cancer
item.dc:creator: Care2 Healthy Living Guest Blogger
item.description: Disease affects all of our lives on some level or another. Our families are affected by it, our friends and co-workers too. Most people only see disease as either a distant potential future event, or something that affects their friends and family. Unfortunately, disease can become a part of our life overnight if we don’t take the right […]

item.title: Erotic Energy: Nature’s Renewable Resource
item.dc:creator: The Green Divas
item.description: Eros, or erotic energy, provides the generative, creative force that inspires the acorn to become the Oak, and the mother wolf to fiercely defend her cubs. Erotic energy is what moves through humans igniting desire, creativity and passion, and connects us to our own bodies and desires, to one another, and to Life itself.

item.title: 6 Little-Known Nutrients that Build Better Vision
item.dc:creator: Michelle Schoffro Cook
item.description: An old adage says that eyes are the windows of the soul, but we also rely on them for just about everything we do in life. It’s important to take good care of our eyes and vision through a largely or entirely plant-based diet. While there are many vitamins and minerals needed for healthy eyes […]

item.title: Is Our Quinoa Obsession Sustainable? It’s Complicated.
item.dc:creator: Becky Striepe
item.description: When it comes to the sustainability of quinoa, the story is more than just black and white. The tasty superseed has its upsides and downsides.

item.title: 25 Vegan Sources for Protein
item.dc:creator: Becky Striepe
item.description: There are plenty of vegan protein sources, and if you make sure to eat a variety of these throughout the week, you won't need to worry about getting enough protein!

item.title: Daily Cute: Dog Gives Hugs on Command
item.dc:creator: Healthy Living Editors
item.description: Sure, there’s the standard dog tricks: sit, shake, maybe roll over. But giving hugs on command is both impressive AND adorable. Source: Dog learns to give hugs on command by Denise on Rumble Check back daily for more adorable animal videos.

item.title: 7 Reasons People Over 40 Need Strength Training
item.dc:creator: Brian Syuki
item.description: Strength training is the best form of exercise you can do after age 40. Not to say that cardio or walking are not important. It’s just that strength training has more benefits than other exercises. Women usually avoid strength training because of the fear of getting bulky. But you have nothing to worry about. Women […]

item.title: Is White Rice Responsible for the Diabetes Spike in China?
item.dc:creator: Dr. Michael Greger
item.description: Rice currently feeds almost half the human population, making it the single most important staple food in the world, but a meta-analysis of seven cohort studies following 350,000 people for up to 20 years found that higher consumption of white rice was associated with a significantly increased risk of type 2 diabetes, especially in Asian […]

item.title: Want to Fight Acne and Fine Lines? Toss Your Face Wash And Start Oil Cleansing
item.dc:creator: Thrive Market
item.description: In 2014, oil cleansing officially became “a thing” in the beauty industry. Face washes formulated with oil took the world by storm, and at $40 to $60 a bottle, these wonder tonics promised smooth, ageless skin. It was a surprising turn of events, since oil had previously been viewed as the enemy of a beautiful complexion for years. As far back as the Victorian […]

item.title: 6 Ways that Traveling the World Can Make You a Better Entrepreneur
item.dc:creator: Ashlyn Kittrell
item.description: For some of us with lofty traveling ambitions, responses to our goals range from “How neat!” to “You’ll never get a job doing that.” Little do the naysayers know, traveling can actually help you become a better worker. More importantly, traveling can engage with your entrepreneurial side in a way that staying put might not. […]

item.title: 4 Proven Natural Remedies to Overcome a Yeast Infection
item.dc:creator: Michelle Schoffro Cook
item.description: If you’ve ever experienced a yeast infection, you’re not alone. 75 percent of women experience vaginitis as the result of a fungal overgrowth of the vaginal area at some point in their life and almost half of women experience multiple yeast infections throughout their life. While you may be in good company, that doesn’t bring […]

item.title: How to Grow and Harvest Garlic
item.dc:creator: Becky Striepe
item.description: If you've always wanted to try growing garlic, now is a great time to start! Here's everything you need to know about how to grow garlic, from clove to harvest.

item.title: What Your Nails Can Tell You About Your Health
item.dc:creator: Thrive Market
item.description: Visit a palm reader, and they’ll appear to glean important info from scrutinizing your hand in search of the life, heart, head, and fate lines. Maybe this crease in the palm indicates luck, and that one reveals you’re likely to find your true love and a fairytale happy ending. The logically minded know all of […]

item.description: This Corgi has the best seat for a bike ride! Source: Corgi sits back, enjoys lovely bike ride by toastthecorgi on Rumble Check back daily for more adorable animal videos.

item.title: 5 Healthiest Kinds of Tea
item.dc:creator: Maggie McCracken
item.description: America’s love affair with coffee is deeply entrenched (and totally understandable), but more and more people are switching over to tea. Tea has been used as medicine for thousands of years, and its health benefits have been lauded by health experts. Tea is delicious, comforting, warm and healthy, but it’s also full of variety. There […]

item.title: One Way Your Ego Can Trip You Up
item.dc:creator: Ed and Deb Shapiro
item.description: One Christmas, when we were living in Brighton, England, we volunteered at a church that regularly feeds the homeless and needy at that time of year. But it was more than the hungry ones who got fed that day. After we happily dished out large helpings of turkey, mashed potatoes and gravy, followed by pudding […]

item.title: Video: Why Does My Dog Dig?
item.dc:creator: Vetstreet.com
item.description: It may be tough to explain to our gardens, but digging is a common, deep-rooted behavior that we can trace back to our dogs’ wild ancestors. So are there other reasons dogs dig? There are many possible reasons — some are harmless, like a canine digging up a hidden toy, while others may signal a […]

item.title: 6 Superpowers Introverts Have
item.dc:creator: Diana Vilibert
item.description: Do you prefer connecting with friends one-on-one rather than meeting a room full of new people? Do you work best in a quiet corner at work, away from the rest of the open-plan office? Do you like being alone? You may be an introvert…and it may be one of your greatest assets. Research from The […]

item.title: Why You Should Support This Year’s Day of Silence
item.dc:creator: Katie Medlock
item.description: This year marks the 20th year the Day of Silence, organized by the Gay, Lesbian & Straight Education Network, has been a quiet, yet powerful force in changing the way children and teens are treated in their schools. On April 15th, thousands of middle school, high school and college students will stand together in solidarity—and […]

item.title: 9 Surprising Things Fungus Can Decompose
item.dc:creator: Zoe Blarowski
item.description: Fungus has an amazing ability to decompose organic matter. But it doesn’t stop at leaves on the forest floor. Fungi can safely recycle a lot of different human waste and pollution. How Decomposition Works In biological terms, “organic” refers to any material that is made up of molecules containing carbon and hydrogen atoms. All living […]

item.title: The Importance of an Environmental Education
item.dc:creator: Jordyn Cormier
item.description: While Earth Day is a pretty big deal, most people don’t realize that it’s immersed within a larger, week-long celebration of the environment and environmental education. This year, the National Environmental Education Foundation celebrates their 12th annual Environmental Education Week. Spanning April 17th through April 23rd, it’s a week of promoting environmental conservation in conjunction with an […]

item.title: Daily Cute: What Could This Dog Be Howling About?

item.description: This Samoyed pup seems to howl for everything—to say hello, to ask to be walked or just to make conversation. What could she be howling about in this video? item.title: Is Milk Actually Good for Our Bones?
item.dc:creator: Dr. Michael Greger
item.description: Milk is touted to build strong bones, but an analysis of all the best studies found no association between milk consumption and hip fracture risk. So drinking milk as an adult might not help bones, but what about in adolescence? Harvard researchers decided to put it to the test. Studies have shown that greater milk […]

item.title: 3 Solar Ovens That Give You the Power to Cook With the Sun
item.dc:creator: EcoWatch
item.description: With barbecue season around the corner, what could be more planet-friendly than cooking with the sun? Instead of gas/electricity/charcoal/wood, a solar cooker harnesses heat from the sun to cook food. From baking cookies to frying eggs, these pollution-free devices work wherever there is sunshine, regardless of how cold it is outside. With ample sunlight, most get into temperatures between 250-350 degrees Fahrenheit, with some top […]

item.title: Got a Fat Feline? How to Help Your Cat Shed Those Extra Pounds

item.description: Obesity is a big problem in cats — literally. So many cats are overweight or obese that it’s a national scandal. (And yes, there’s a difference between overweight and obese: Overweight cats are 10 to 29 percent over ideal weight while obese cats are 30 percent or more over ideal weight.) More than half of […]

item.title: 2016 Dirty Dozen: 10 Foods to Always Buy Organic
item.dc:creator: Becky Striepe
item.description: The EWG has released its 2016 Shopper's Guide, ranking 50 popular fruits and vegetables for pesticides. These are the ones that top their list, plus more on how and why to reduce your pesticide exposure.

item.title: 5 Ways to Be a Better Cat Owner
item.dc:creator: Vetstreet.com
item.description: They say dogs have owners, cats have staff. And what better way to serve your favorite feline than to make a commitment to being a better cat owner? item.title: 6 Subtle Habits You Didn’t Know Were Causing You to Overeat
item.dc:creator: Elise Moreau
item.description: It’s easier than you think to overeat on healthy foods when you’re not diligently measuring and weighing your portions. And who has the time to do that for every meal and snack anyway? As someone who has spent years developing a solid understanding of calories and portion sizes for a variety of foods, I still slip up from time […]

item.title: 7 Reasons Treadmill Runners Should Try Outdoor Running
item.dc:creator: Brian Syuki
item.description: There’s a lot of debate over which is more effective between outdoor and treadmill running. Frankly, both have advantages and disadvantages. But I won’t dwell on which one is better – the best exercise is the one you do. Well, you may want to try outdoor running if you’re a treadmill diehard. Read the points […]

item.dc:creator: Healthy Living Editors
item.description: These two cuddly friends fall asleep very quickly as dad tells them a story…and even after the story is long over. Source: Baby and puppy fall asleep during bedtime story by beshoyfahim on Rumble Check back daily for more adorable animal videos.

item.title: Is Marathon Running Bad for Your Health?
item.dc:creator: Maggie McCracken
item.description: Are you a marathon runner or do you aspire to someday make the 26-mile journey that is a full marathon? However, if you’re running the race for […]

item.title: 3 Tough Conversations You Need to Have With Your Aging Parents
item.dc:creator: Caring.com
item.description: Caring for an aging parent occasionally requires difficult conversations. There are three tough topics in particular that become inevitable with aging parents: driving, moving and end-of-life wishes. However difficult it may be to discuss these subjects, it’s vitally important to do so—avoiding them could lead to devastating consequences. 1. Stopping Driving If you’re concerned about your […]

item.title: Cutting Food Waste Would Help Fight Climate Change
item.dc:creator: TreeHugger
item.description: I suspect it’s pretty much consensus opinion that the amount of food we waste, while people go hungry, is obscene. What’s less well recognized, however, is that cutting food waste isn’t just a way to fight hunger. It could also help us reduce the negative impacts of climate change. A new study from Potsdam Institute […]

item.title: 6 Vibrant Kale Salad Recipes
item.dc:creator: Katie Medlock
item.description: As we shake off the last chill of winter, we are greeted with the promise of vibrant spring vegetables to keep us energized and ready for the excitement of summer. Kale has become one of the more popular leafy greens, and for good reason. Raw food enthusiasts argue that eating kale without heating it provides […]

item.title: This Young Entrepreneur Wants YOU to Help Save the Bees
item.dc:creator: Jordyn Cormier
item.description: BeeSweet Lemonade isn’t your run-of-the-mill beverage company. Started by an incredible girl, now only 11-years-old, BeeSweet is a company with a mission: to save the honeybees. It all started when Mikaila Ulmer, at age three, got her first bee stings. Unlike most children, rather than fostering a fear of all things that buzz, she became […]

item.title: 11 Fascinating Facts You Never Knew About Your Brain
item.dc:creator: Thrive Market
item.description: It only weighs 3 pounds. It runs on about 20 watts of electricity. It’s what sets us apart from other animals. Figure it out yet? We’re talking about the human brain. While it’s undoubtedly the most important organ, we tend to forget about it while it’s quietly keeping the body breathing, walking, and talking. The brain does […]

item.title: Are Basil Seeds a New Superfood?
item.dc:creator: Zoe Blarowski
item.description: Basil seeds have been used traditionally in Ayurvedic and Chinese medicine, and now they’re starting to get noticed in the West. Although research is still emerging to support the various health claims surrounding basil seeds, they definitely look like a healthy seed worth adding to your diet. Which basil seeds? The basil seeds that are […]

item.title: How To De-Stink Your Garbage Disposal
item.dc:creator: Ann Pietrangelo
item.description: What's stinking up your kitchen sink? You clean it and clean it and yet it reeks. There's a good chance that the foul odor is wafting up from your garbage disposal. It can make the cleanest kitchen seem unfit for preparing food.

Keep up with all Sam related news with the hashtag “#findsam.” Students Send Stuffed Dog Into SpaceThese kids […]

item.title: Coming Soon: More Birth Control Options for Men
item.dc:creator: Alex A. Kecskes
item.description: Currently, the major options for male birth control are wearing a condom or getting an essentially permanent vasectomy. Fortunately, there may be several new options for male birth control. The roadblock has been the male anatomy: Men produce about 1,000 sperm every second, according to Mara Roth, MD, an endocrinologist and assistant professor of medicine […]

item.title: Make Your Own Edible Utensils!
item.dc:creator: TreeHugger
item.description: Plastic is one of the most enduring materials that man makes. It takes anywhere from 500 to 1,000 years for it to degrade, yet half of the plastic we produce we use only once. We are a species of such exquisite folly! In 2012, 288 million tons of plastic were manufactured globally … is it […]

item.title: This Fermented Japanese Fruit Is Great for Your Health

item.description: We all strive to consume a more well-rounded, macrobiotic diet. However, our diets and lifestyles are not always pristine. We get stressed. We eat junk. item.title: 15 Amazing Benefits of Ghee

item.description: Modern science now verifies what Ayurvedic health science has said for thousands of years: Ghee has a host of health and cooking benefits and is good for the mind and spirit. item.title: 5 Cost-Free Ways to Spark Creativity

item.description: Back in 2012, Adobe released a study that revealed that more than 75 percent of individuals feel they aren’t living up to their creative potential. item.title: Free Ways to Celebrate National Park Week

item.description: National Park Week celebrates America’s natural – and national – heritage. item.description: When it comes to ethics and environmental concerns, the iconic denim brand Levi Strauss & Co. has a pretty good reputation. From introducing water-recycling processes in Chinese factories to encouraging people not to wash their jeans to treating employees well, the company is always on the lookout for new ways to improve. item.description: A lot of people say that they’d go vegetarian if it weren’t for one holdout: bacon. item.title: Is Daydreaming Healthy?
item.dc:creator: Maggie McCracken
item.description: Everyone daydreams, to some degree or another. Some of us may harbor elaborate, visually stunning fantasies, while others just occasionally muse about a promotion at work—but we all daydream. Because it comes in so many different forms, daydreaming can be either positive or negative for our mental health. Sometimes, our imagination manifests as anxiety, causing […]

item.title: Having Tattoos May Mean Your Immune System Rocks
item.dc:creator: Katie Medlock
item.description: Anyone who has endured a tattoo session knows the process isn’t exactly a cakewalk. This includes the healing process. Like any other experience that breaks skin, tattoos require a healing period in which the body recovers from the trauma. A new study supports the idea that going under the needle affects our immune system and […]
